title: Ticket #5924: Add bash completion scripts for CLI tools
description:
I recently learned how to do bash completion scripts for a separate project. While I find them really fairly miserable to write as a developer, they are pretty awesome as a user.

Let's add a few for the most common HTCondor commands.
remarks:
2016-Sep-27 23:01:39 by bbockelm:
Example from the just-uploaded completion script: 

$ condor_q -pool red-condor.unl.edu -name <tab>
red-gw1.unl.edu         red-gw2.unl.edu         red.unl.edu             t3.unl.edu

When you hit tab after the -name argument, bash will query the collector for a list of schedds and suggest auto-completions from this list.

Similarly, if -allusers is set, it'll suggest a list of active users based on the output of condor_status -submitter.

The idea is that, similarly, condor_status could suggest a list of matching startd names - or condor_userprio could suggest usernames for the -resetusage command.

Still needs CMake integration and packaging; basic idea shines through.
